title: Castro CBD Communications on APE and Castro Theatre

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents, records and communications, including emails and texts and copies of original petitions with signatures, to and from the San Francisco Castro Community Benefit District staff and members of the board of directors (including executive director Andrea Aiello and board member Ralph Hibbs) concerning Another Planet Entertainment (APE) and the Castro Theatre, between January 1, 2022 and date of this filing request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Synergy 94114

title: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request – Invoices and Itemized Receipts for Inception, Planning and Construction of Clinton Market Collective (Capitalize Albany Corporation)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request – Invoices and Itemized Receipts for the Construction of Clinton Market Collective

Dear Records Access Officer,

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, I am requesting access to and copies of all invoices, itemized receipts, and financial records related to the inception, planning, design or construction of the Clinton Market Collective project located at 11 Clinton Avenue in Albany, New York. The construction of this project is supported by more than $3.5 million in local, state, and federal assistance.

The Clinton Market Collective project is being carried out by the following entities:

Schenectady-based landscape architecture firm PLACEAlliance as the designer.
Construction management services are being provided by TW&A.
Construction is being led by James H. Maloy, Inc.

The funding for this project comes from various sources, including the New York State Department of State, the City of Albany as part of its American Rescue Plan Act funding process, National Grid, and Capitalize Albany Corporation.

Please provide me with all invoices and itemized receipts for this project from its inception to the present. If any of the requested records cannot be disclosed, please cite the specific exemptions under FOIL and provide me with any segregable portion of the record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request – Invoices and Itemized Receipts for Inception, Planning and Construction of Clinton Market Collective (City Of Albany)

The construction of this project is supported by more than $3.5 million in local, state, and federal assistance.

The Clinton Market Collective project is being carried out by the following entities:

Schenectady-based landscape architecture firm PLACEAlliance as the designer.
Construction management services are being provided by TW&A.
Construction is being led by James H. Maloy, Inc.

The funding for this project comes from various sources, including the New York State Department of State, the City of Albany as part of its American Rescue Plan Act funding process, National Grid, and Capitalize Albany Corporation.

Please provide me with all invoices and itemized receipts for this project from its inception to the present. If any of the requested records cannot be disclosed, please cite the specific exemptions under FOIL and provide me with any segregable portion of the record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Police Staff Roster (May 2023) (Whatcom County Sheriff's Office)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Staff roster including but not limited to first and last names, job titles, areas of assignment, and badge, serial, and other identifying numbers. In order of preference, I would prefer that this data be provided as: plain text with comma-separated-values (i.e., a "CSV" file), OpenDocument spreadsheet, Excel spreadsheet, or the native electronic format of the software from which this information is retrieved in fulfillment of my request. I specifically request that you not create a new record for me by rendering to PDF or by printing your electronic record then scanning it to make a series of images of the printed data.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

title: Gabon Uprising/ January 2019 (Department of Defense, Office of the Secretary of Defense)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, in 2019, US military members were operating in Gabon to quell unrest on the Congo. However, a coup ensued in Gabon due to accusations that President Ali Bongo was a deep fake. I would like all documents -- classified and unclassified -- pertaining to military operations during this timeframe: 01 January 2019 until 01 February 2019.  I have attached an article pertaining to said uprising.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: FBI use of Discord

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI use of Discord
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all records, documents, and materials held by the Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) concerning the use, monitoring, or investigation of the messaging platform Discord from January 1, 2015, to the present day.

The requested information should include, but not be limited to:

1. Any FBI investigative files, reports, memos, or correspondence involving the use of Discord by individuals or groups for criminal activities, including but not limited to cybercrime, terrorism, or hate crimes;
2. Any records of communication or cooperation between the FBI and Discord (the company), or any other law enforcement or intelligence agencies, foreign or domestic, in relation to the use, monitoring, or investigation of activities on the Discord platform;
3. Any guidelines, policies, or procedures established by the FBI for monitoring or investigating communications on Discord, and any training materials provided to FBI personnel concerning the use of Discord for investigative purposes;
4. Any records of complaints, inquiries, or reports submitted to the FBI regarding activities on Discord or the use of Discord by individuals or groups for criminal activities.

Please search not only for main file records (this is the FBI’s default search) but also for “cross-reference” records in the FBI's Central Records System, Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) records, and any other appropriate records systems for the requested information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Gabriel Garcia

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all records, documents, and materials held by the Virginia State Police relating to ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents from January 1, 2013, to the present day.

The requested information should include, but not be limited to:

1. Any investigative files, reports, memos, or correspondence related to ransomware, malware, or hacking cases involving individuals, businesses, or government entities within the Commonwealth of Virginia;
2. Any records of communication or cooperation between the Virginia State Police and other law enforcement, intelligence agencies, or cybersecurity firms in relation to ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents;
3. Statistical data or aggregated information concerning the number of ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents reported to or investigated by the Virginia State Police on an annual basis;
4. Any records of complaints, inquiries, or reports submitted to the Virginia State Police regarding ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents;
5. Any training materials, presentations, or guidelines provided to Virginia State Police personnel concerning the investigation of ransomware, malware, or hacking incidents.

Please search the relevant records systems of the Virginia State Police for the requested information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Suspected Shoplifting Incident at Walmart on April 22 2023

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Fishkill Town Clerk
807 Route 52, Room 114
Fishkill, NY 12524


Subject: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request

Dear Fishkill Town Clerk:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) (Article 6 of the Public Officers Law), I hereby request access to and copies of the following records concerning the Fishkill Town Police Department:

The 911 audio recording of the call made to report a suspected shoplifting incident that occurred at Walmart, 26 W Merritt Blvd, Fishkill, NY 12524, on April 22,2023 specifically between the time frame of 6:00 PM and 7:00 PM.
Dashcam and body camera footage from the Fishkill Town Police Department officers who responded to the aforementioned suspected shoplifting incident.
Names and badge numbers of the Fishkill Town Police Department officers who responded to the suspected shoplifting incident.
Incident reports, including any narratives, witness statements, and evidence logs, generated by the Fishkill Town Police Department concerning the suspected shoplifting incident in question.
In accordance with the FOIL and relevant case law, including Westchester Rockland Newspapers v. Kimball (50 NY2d 575, 581 [1980]), Scott, Sardano & Pomeranz v. Records Access Officer of Syracuse (65 N.Y.2d 294 [1985]), and Matter of New York Times Co. v. City of NY Fire Dept. (4 N.Y.3d 477 [2005]), I kindly request that you do not withhold, redact, or delete any records or portions of records unless there is a specific and legitimate exemption under the New York State FOIL.

Please be aware that I am prepared to pursue legal action to compel the release of the requested records if they are unlawfully withheld, redacted, or deleted. It is my hope that we can resolve this request amicably and without the need for litigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: Request for Historical Records on Fishkill Encampment and American Revolution Bicentennial Memorial

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Fishkill Town Clerk
807 Route 52, Room 114
Fishkill, NY 12524

Subject: Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) Request

Dear Fishkill Town Clerk:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) (Article 6 of the Public Officers Law), I hereby request access to and copies of the following records:

Documents, maps, and photographs related to the planning, design, construction, and dedication of the American Revolution Bicentennial Memorial in Fishkill, NY, including any records of public meetings or correspondence discussing the memorial.

Historical accounts, personal letters, or diary entries from the time of the Fishkill Encampment that provide firsthand perspectives on the events and daily life at the encampment.

Records of archaeological studies, surveys, or excavations conducted at the site of the Fishkill Encampment, including any findings, reports, or artifacts uncovered during such investigations.

Geographic Information System (GIS) data, maps, and any other relevant spatial data related to the American Revolution Bicentennial Memorial and the Fishkill Encampment, including historical maps that show the layout of the encampment and its surrounding area during the Revolutionary War.

Documents related to the preservation and maintenance of the Fishkill Encampment site and the American Revolution Bicentennial Memorial, including any records of grants, funding sources, or partnerships with preservation organizations.

Any educational materials, brochures, or pamphlets produced by the town or local historical organizations about the American Revolution Bicentennial Memorial and the Fishkill Encampment, intended for public distribution or use in local schools.

In accordance with the FOIL and relevant case law, including Westchester Rockland Newspapers v. Kimball (50 NY2d 575, 581 [1980]), I kindly request that you do not withhold, redact, or delete any records or portions of records unless there is a specific and legitimate exemption under the New York State FOIL. Furthermore, please note that the Court of Appeals in Gould v. New York City Police Department (89 NY2d 267, 277 [1996]) held that an agency must provide access to reasonably segregable portions of a record that are not exempt from disclosure.

If you determine that any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, please provide an itemized list of those exemptions and cite the specific legal basis for each exemption under the New York State FOIL. Additionally, I request that you release any reasonably segregable portions of the records that are not exempt from disclosure.

Please be aware that I am prepared to pursue legal action to compel the release of the requested records if they are unlawfully withheld, redacted, or deleted. It is my hope that we can resolve this request amicably and without the need for litigation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: 1961 assault and battery
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents regarding the "atrocious assault and battery" investigated by the Morristown Police Department and reported to the FBI on September 28, 1961.

An FBI memo from 1962 mentions that on the above date, a Morristown detective told the Bureau about someone arrested "on charges of atrocious assault and battery...The detective advised that on [DATE REDACTED], a call was received from the landlady at [ADDRESS REDACTED] reporting that a man had been found in a room severely beaten. This man was subsequently identified as [NAME REDACTED] later turned himself into the Morristown, New Jersey, Police Department, at which time he could not be interviewed because of his emotional condition...A doctor was called and [NAME REDACTED] was given sedatives and transferred to the Morristown County Jail."

You may find a copy of the memo attached below.

I am requesting the police report from that incident and any written communication to the FBI in September 1961.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Children in New York "start their day going to the corner bodega, buying cannabis and fentanyl."

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Children in New York "start their day going to the corner bodega, buying cannabis and fentanyl."
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records in the Department's possession that mention, describe, or pertain to the recent claims by the Mayor of New York City that cannabis products are contaminated with fentanyl and being purchased by children in New York City.  These records would be within the Department's Subject Matter List, headings "Mental Health & Drug/Alcohol Surveillance & Programs" and "Poison Control Center."

The specific quote by the Mayor about children is that "they start their day going to the corner bodega, buying cannabis and fentanyl." See @theRecount. 2023. “‘[Kids] Start Their Day Going to the Corner Bodega, Buying Cannabis and Fentanyl ... They Look at TikTok, That’s Teaching Them How to Steal Cars.’ — NYC Mayor Eric Adams (D) Echoes GOP Talking Points While Speaking at the National Day of Prayer Conference".” Twitter. May 4, 2023. https://twitter.com/therecount/status/1654198878781034502.

Should there exist any record that an actual child in New York City has started their day, specifically purchasing with a cannabis product contaminated with fentanyl, please only provide that record. 

In the absence of such a specific record, I request any and all records of the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene with regard to *any* part of the claim, regardless of whether it is actual or merely rumored, so long as it involves cannabis products contaminated with fentanyl.  That is, any and all records that fit the following bullet point descriptions should be treated as responsive:

* Records mentioning, describing, or pertaining to the existence (actual or merely rumored) of cannabis products contaminated with fentanyl;
* Records mentioning, describing, or pertaining to the existence (actual or merely rumored) of cannabis products contaminated with fentanyl that are possessed or available for purchase;
* Records mentioning, describing, or pertaining to the existence (actual or merely rumored) of cannabis products contaminated with fentanyl that are possessed or available for purchase by children;
* Records mentioning, describing, or pertaining to the existence (actual or merely rumored) of cannabis products contaminated with fentanyl that are possessed or available for purchase in New York City;
* Records mentioning, describing, or pertaining to the existence (actual or merely rumored) of cannabis products contaminated with fentanyl that are possessed or available for purchase in New York City by children. 

Please note: in a February 2023 press conference, the Mayor specifically authorized the speedy public release of information about this claim, as quoted here: "We'll give a list of what we are finding and what they are mixed with, if it is fentanyl or others. So I'll have the N.Y.P.D. give a list of what we're finding in it. We'll get that to you today." (see “Transcript: Mayor Eric Adams Announces Joint Efforts to Combat Proliferation of Illegal, Unlicensed Cannabis Dispensaries.” 2023. The Official Website of the City of New York. February 2023. https://www.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/096-23/transcript-mayor-eric-adams-joint-efforts-combat-proliferation-illegal-unlicensed.)

As the Mayor specifically alludes to evidence of his claims and specifically authorizes its release, there are no grounds for citing public safety exemptions to FOIL in withholding a record such as law enforcement secrecy or ongoing investigation. Please note that the a document marked"For Official Use Only" has no special classified status under the law and should be released.  

Disclosure of these records will serve the public interest of avoiding bodegas selling cannabis with fentanyl contamination, evaluating the truth of statements regarding fentanyl and understanding the current state of the War on Drugs. This public good should be evaluated before the withholding of documents or redaction citing privacy interests. 

Under New York State FOIL, wrongful withholding of information may give rise to a lawsuit under Article 78 proceeding in which the agency will be expected to pay reasonable attorney's fees to gain its compliance with the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee
